statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Southern Miss 83, East Carolina 72
article.story: HATTIESBURG, Miss. (AP) -- Craig Craft and Sai'Quon Stone scored 19 points apiece as Southern Mississippi beat visiting East Carolina 83-72 in Wednesday night. With the win, the Golden Eagles (13-5, 3-2) move above the .500 level in league play for the first time in six years. It is also the first time Southern Miss has won two consecutive regular season league games in three years. The Golden Eagles were coming off a 57-55 overtime win over Alabama-Birmingham on Saturday. East Carolina (5-13, 0-5) lost its fifth straight game and has now dropped 12 of its last 13. Stone's total included 17 points from the free-throw line. He tied the school record with 20 attempts from the charity stripe. The Golden Eagles placed four players in double figures in the win, as Jeremy Wise added 15 and Courtney Beasley had 12. Southern Miss overcame an early 15-7 deficit and took a 30-28 lead at halftime. The Golden Eagles were 0-for-7 from behind the 3-point arch in the first half but made four 3-pointers in the first 10 minutes of the second half, part of an 18-6 run. Darrell Jenkins scored a game high 25 points for ECU, and Courtney Captain added 20 for the Pirates. Jenkins was 5-of-9 from 3-point range.
